intro: Aeschynanthus lepidospermus, commonly known as the velvet orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pendulous flowers that resemble orchids. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Aeschynanthus lepidospermus is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
